results.description:
This group meets every Thursday at 7:00 pm. for an hour and 15 minutes of meditation and mutual support. If your looking for someone to do something to you, or for you, keep looking ! If your willing to show up and work on yourself ,with kindness and patience, that's what we're doing together here. We are like geese flying together ,each one "drafting" off the others , and supporting the others at the same time. The average attendance for this group is probably 4 or 5 people, even though most don't RSVP on meetup, so don't be afraid that you will be the only one there if you don't see other RSVPs.(Is that a word?)

  Thank you for your kind attention, Randy
results.name: Join us for a guided meditation followed by discussion ,reflection and questions

results.description:
Hello,

Thank you for visiting this page. Whether you're new to Massachusetts, new to Toastmasters or looking for a different club, this is the place to be. We meet every FIRST & THIRD Thursdays of every month, twice a month.

This is a very friendly supportive, encouraging environment. members come come a variety of cultures and academic & professional background. 

Minutemen Toastmasters Club is a great place to learn to speak in front of the audience, accept constructive feedback, manage your time and network with a diverse culture, that is committed to each other's success.

If you are new, you can attend the club three times to assess if it meets your needs. On the third meeting we suggest you join the club as a member. You are also free to visit other clubs to satisfy your personal needs. 


Please RSVP for all the future meetings!!


Thank you,

~VJ / VP Membership

Everyone and all levels are welcome. Come and enjoy bouldering, getting to know fellow bouldering people and have lots of fun.

results.description:
Thursday night figure drawing has an emphasis on one long pose, giving time for more involved approaches.  Painters and drawers welcome to this informal and supportive group, meeting in Damon's painting studio.


A few warm up quick poses will be followed by a long (2.5 hour) pose, with breaks for the model.

Members pay $10 as on Monday night, non-member drop-in is $25.  Membership fee for each month of $25 brings discounts on drawing and painting sessions and classes.  Pay membership fee online (see left-hand column) via paypal or credit card, or in person with cash or check.  First session of the month would therefore be $35 ($25 membership fee plus $10 session fee) and each session thereafter would be $10. 

Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Central Street and Vernon Street, big brick building.  Park on Vernon street in front of building or in lot behind building.

results.description:
Click HERE to purchase your ticket or get on the waitlist - RSVP does NOT reserve a spot.  

This will be a fun evening of getting to know a whole bunch of eligible people in one night. There will be many opportunities to interact and connect and get to know each other. Opportunities to get real and have fun and really get a sense of someone.

Like speed dating you will be able to privately indicate if you are interested in someone. And after the event you will get a list of matches. 

• This will also just be a fun social gathering. There will be plenty of time just to hang out and connect. 

• Wine and appetizers will be provided.

Click here for An Audio Testimonial ---

Thank you to you and Katie for a warm & entertaining event! It was a fun evening and fostered personal growth and new connections. Looking forward to future events.-Aimee P

So sweet! Loved Kate's energy and completely fun experience. Thank you Jon you rock!-Mary Carol

Wow. That was *fantastic*. The activities (and the wine) made meeting lots of interesting people really easy and a huge amount of fun. And the loft gallery location was perfect. I would definitely do it again. Thanks Jon, Katie and Abby!- Matt

I had a great time John and Katie were excellent host's. It was fun and a learning curve for me. There were a lot of great Singles there. The nicest thing was you never felt uncomfortable with anyone. I would recommend this to anyone jumping back into the dating scene. - Howard

That was a wonderful evening - fun, engaging. Definitely a success. Much more interaction than a typical speed dating event. Katie and Jon - nice job combining interesting activities, a great space and tasty food -Karen

--

• A prepaid ticket is required in order to keep it gender-balanced

• Click HERE to purchase your ticket. There will be NO ticket sales at the door.

• Click HERE to join our mailing list for future events..

Please note: when you check out it says "Pay with PayPal" but you don't need to have paypal account and can use any major credit card. Hopefully see you soon!

Jon

Accelerate your personal and spiritual transformation by receiving the Lightarian Rays.  A series of powerful, guided meditation attunements inspired by the Celestial Masters, Maitreya, El Morya, Buddha, Sananda, St. Germain, as well as our Universal Source!

The 1st five Rays focus on the essential phases of spiritual processing: Empowerment, Clearing, Healing, Activation, and Manifestation.

The 6th Ray, Source Ray - focuses on lifting you further into the unfolding global human ascension process.

The Lightarian Perspective:

Self-empowerment is the starting point for the spiritual awakening process ©  Then, the clearer you become, the more effectively you can heal ©  The more you clear and heal, then the greater can be your rate of personal energetic activations ©  All leading to a greater ability for you to manifest a higher level of Light in your day-to-day life!

Empowerment Ray

The starting point for the spiritual awakening process and serves as the pre-requisite for receiving the other Rays.  The Empowerment Ray stimulates a dramatic “spiritual wake-up call” of the highest order, triggering waves of energetic acceleration and vibrational changes.

Clearing Ray

Launches a gentle, effective “etheric deep cleaning” stripping away all of your adverse soul programming, inappropriate belief structures, and undesired mental and emotional patterns.

Healing Ray

Initiates a powerful process of holistic self-healing, returning you to a state of balance and alignment.

Activation Ray

Energetically activates your latent etheric coding and triggers powerful, ongoing spiritual initiations – allowing more of your Higher Self energies to flow into your day to day life.

Manifestation Ray

Expands your capacity for manifesting on all levels, opening you to attract spiritual, mental, emotional, and physical abundance…all to serve your highest process!

Source Ray

A connection with the energies of our Universal Source.  This Ray creates a dramatic leap to a new vibrational connection with even higher levels of divine energies. The first five Ray’s are a pre-requisite for receiving the Source Ray.

See you there!

results.description: Come check out dragon boating with Living Root! We're a co-ed dragon boat team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, stay in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive. How to get there: We practice at the pool at the JFK Elementary School in Somerville. Walk through the outdoor basketball courts to the rear of the building to find the pool entrance. Take the stairs down to the ground floor and head through the locker rooms to get to the pool. Practice will begin poolside at 7 pm. Wear athletic clothing. Although we won't do any swimming, you will get somewhat wet. Parking is free in the school parking lot. The T station at Porter Square is a 5 minute walk away. Practice will last an hour and 45 minutes. We provide paddles and all the necessary equipment--just bring yourself! No paddling experience is required. We have an excellent coaching staff who will teach you everything you will need to know. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us. Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked] [url=http://www.livingroot.org/]www.livingroot.org[/url]
results.how_to_find_us: We meet by the pool.

The Harvard Center for Astrophysics is holding a special movie night event. I've never been to a movie night there so I don't know what kind of line to expect.  Let's meet at 7 (movie starts at 7:30). From their website:

*****
Introduction by Dr. Jonathan McDowell (CfA) 

 
Dr. Ryan Stone (Sandra Bullock) is on her first shuttle mission. Her commander is veteran astronaut Matt Kowalsky (George Clooney), helming his last flight before retirement. Then, during a routine space walk by the pair, disaster strikes. The shuttle is destroyed, leaving Ryan and Matt stranded in orbit with no hope of rescue. Could such an accident really happen? And could an astronaut survive as depicted in the movie? Learn the answers from space-program expert Jonathan McDowell, and then enjoy this visually stunning masterpiece by director Alfonso Cuaron.
******
https://www.cfa.harvard.edu/publicevents

results.description:
Frequency by Penny Pierce: an LoA Book Conversation

Thursday, March 3, 2016


7:00 PM

Wakefield, MA" style


1321 Main St., 2nd Floor, Wakefield, MA 

We are right above McGill's Convenient Store, on the 2nd Floor. Please Use Street Parking.Price: $5.00 /per person

Are you interested in learning how to Raise your Energy Vibrations? 


Because we see the world from a physical perspective, we often don't notice what's right in front of us — that our spirit, thoughts, emotions, and body are all made of energy. Inside us and everywhere around us, life is vibrating. In fact, each of us has a personal vibration that accurately communicates who we are to the world and helps shape our reality. The Book Frequency by Penny Pierce shows readers how to feel their personal vibration, improve it, and use it to shift their life from ordinary to extraordinary. A simple shift in frequency can change depression to peace, anger to stillness, and fear to enthusiasm. 

Frequency gives readers a reassuring, step-by-step roadmap into a positive state of awareness that Peirce calls The Intuition Age. By learning to use "frequency principles" — methods based on the way energy actually functions — readers can keep their energy level high and productive, receive subtle information directly from the environment via "empathic resonance," and quickly free themselves from negative or low "vibrations." 

Join us for a LoA Book Conversation and feel your vibrations Rise!

Frequency is about 250 pages, we will review Chapters 1-6 in this meetup and the remainder next month.

This will be an open forum style book review, highly recommended to take notes while reading to share your highlights/low lights.

Frequency gives readers the tools to understand how and why their natural frequency interacts with the world around them.

Weaving together basic ideas from quantum physics with proven intuition development techniques, Frequency takes readers into deeper concepts only hinted at in recent popular books and DVD's featuring the Law of Attraction. By learning to refine the "conscious sensitivity" of their body, readers can improve relationships, find upscale solutions to problems, and materialize a life that contains everything they want and need to live their destiny. 

Facilitators: Ellen Sklaver & Sue Collins
results.name: Frequency by Penny Pierce - How to raise your vibrations & LOA

venue.name: Phillips Auditorium, Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics

results.description:
Events for the Public

The Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics sponsors a variety of free programs for the public. Among these events are Observatory Nights held on the third Thursday of the month (excluding June, July and August). Observatory Nights feature a nontechnical lecture and telescopic observing from the observatory roof if weather permits. The lectures are intended for high-school age and older audiences but children are also welcome. We also sponsor a variety of other special astronomical events throughout the year. No reservations are necessary, but seating is limited to the auditorium's capacity. Admission is free.

These events--unless otherwise noted--are held in Phillips Auditorium (at the rear of the CfA complex near Madison Street and large parking lot), 60 Garden Street, Cambridge, about 1 mile west of Harvard Square. Parking lots marked for Observatory Staff are open to the public on event nights. Parking is free.

The Observatory does not host private events.

Monthly Observatory Night
Thursday, March 3, 2016
7:30 pm: Sci-fi Movie Night - "Gravity" (PG-13)


Introduction by Dr. Jonathan McDowell (CfA)


Dr. Ryan Stone (Sandra Bullock) is on her first shuttle mission. Her commander is veteran astronaut Matt Kowalsky (George Clooney), helming his last flight before retirement. Then, during a routine space walk by the pair, disaster strikes. The shuttle is destroyed, leaving Ryan and Matt stranded in orbit with no hope of rescue. Could such an accident really happen? And could an astronaut survive as depicted in the movie? Learn the answers from space-program expert Jonathan McDowell, and then enjoy this visually stunning masterpiece by director Alfonso Cuaron.

For more information, including accessibility, or to sign up for the events mailing list, call the Public Affairs Office, (617)[masked] or email [masked]. Please request sign-language interpretation at least 2 weeks before the event. Current sky information is available.

Entrance is at the west of the CfA complex, near Madison Street and large parking lot. The CfA is easily reached by public transportation. From the Harvard MBTA Station (Red Line), take any bus or trackless trolley going west on Concord Avenue (Arlmont Village and Belmont Center buses, Huron Avenue trolleys) and get off at "Observatory Hill."

Source(s): http://www.cfa.harvard.edu/publicevents
results.name: Special Event - Sci-fi Movie Night - "Gravity" (PG-13)

results.description: FRAGS (FRAmingham GamerS) meets at my house in Framingham on Thursdays. I have been running this event for over 30 years. I have hundreds of games, a full-size pool table, and 15-seat movie theater for PS3 games including BUZZ and ROCK BAND, in addition to movies. This event is open to all members of Unity Games, Metrowest Gamers, MENSA, Meetup, and others. results.description:
March is a great time to visit our local sugar shacks. Many of them have interesting displays of sugaring related kitsch. It is so much fun to photograph all aspects of the process of boiling the sap. 

There is no specific location for this meet-up. You can go to massmaple.org to find a sugar house near you. You can also explore local roads to find sap buckets. If we get some snow, the buckets hanging on the maple trees are very photogenic.

This year Maple Weekend is March 19 and 20, but you can go at any time through the month of March. Check the massmaple.org website to find the hours that the sugar houses are open to the public. Looking forward to seeing everyone's interpretation of this traditional "beginning of Spring" event. All photos should be submitted by April 10.
results.name: Let's photograph Maple Sugaring!

In the Fall/Winter (September - April), we have scrimmages every Thursday night (except holidays) starting at 9:00 pm at the Simoni Skating Arena in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
All players of all skill levels are welcome. Come and skate with us, or just stop by to meet the players and learn more about Boston Pride Hockey.

Note:  Pose will be the same as the Saturday 3-hour sessions, so if you want to get a REALLY long pose, sign up for both.  

Jeremy Durling will host- Jeremy's paintings are available through the Sloane Merrill Gallery on Charles Street in Boston.  

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $20 (members) or $30 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html


PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $70 or $85 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
What happened? A tale of two Americas: 1900 – 2000 - Robert Putnam

Robert Putnam is the Peter and Isabel Malkin Professor of Public Policy at Harvard University

Event link HERE ... (free and open to the public). 

Friday, March 4th, 2-4pm

CGIS Knafel Building (Room K450)


1737 Cambridge Street


Robert Putnam is a member of the National Academy of Sciences, a Fellow of the British Academy, and past president of the American Political Science Association. In 2006, Putnam received the Skytte Prize, the world's highest accolade for a political scientist, and in 2012, he received the National Humanities Medal, the nation’s highest honor for contributions to the humanities.  Raised in a small town in the Midwest and educated at Swarthmore, Oxford, and Yale, he has served as Dean of the Kennedy School of Government. The London Sunday Times has called him “the most influential academic in the world today.” 


This event is hosted by the Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University.
results.name: What happened? A tale of two Americas: 1900 – 2000

results.description:
Do you want OTHER people to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in McCormack Senior Center.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery in North Andover - often from other sites, also).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely from this meetup or others: Craigslist, EventBrite, local schools - colleges, graduate and professional schools, academies, training programs, etc.) 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in South Boston

McCormack Task Force
345 Old Colony Ave.
Next to St. Monica's Church
(Near Andrew Red Line)
Inside Task Force building 
Fridays 2:30 - 3:30 PM (Show up by 2 pm for setup)


Each Friday, from 2:00 - 4:00 pm

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Friday midafternoon $2/bag of produce at McCormack Senior Center in mSouth jBoston.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.


Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

We arrive around 2 pm (maybe as late as 2:30 pm) and work until 4 pm (can leave as early as 3:30 pm if we've finished).

http://www.buzzfile.com/Home/Map?m=7790814

Near Columbia Road, Andrew Red Line stop - about 7 minutes walk, 0.3 miles

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!


Please e-mail organizer with your e-mail address and cellphone (in case we need to converse about this more, or contact you before the event).


Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 


TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!! 

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.  

TALK with us FIRST !! 

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas  

Vegan Cooking Classes or 
                 Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food 
                    (using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 

* What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag? 
* Portion Control 
* Bake...Don't Fry! 
* Roasted Veggie Stackers 
* No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream 
* Avocados!!! 
* Salad with Chipotle Hummus 
* Simple Cilantro Chutney 
* More $2 bags of Produce! 
* Drink your greens!

Question:
This sounds like a great deal, but is it meant for those in need, as is the case with food banks?


Answer:
No qualifications - no limits
We have way more than AMPLE food for any intended audiences, and the operation is bettered if MORE people take the food than if FEWER take the food.

Therefore, there is NO QUALIFICATION (no test of need) and no limit to how much you can cart off (just pay $2/bag and $1/loaf of bread).  That's why I post it on a meetup like this.
Make us busy - very busy.
results.name: FREE - VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in McCormack

venue.name: Tufts University Center for Cognitive Studies

results.description:
Registration for this event is closed. If you have not already registered AND received a ticket, you will not gain entry. 

A "Yes" RSVP here will NOT get you in! ...

... so please don't go if you aren't already registered. 

Thanks.

Steve

:: :: ::

Daniel Dennett, Co-Director of the Center for Cognitive Studies and University Professor at Tufts University, will host an afternoon symposium at Tufts University, on March 4th, 2016, featuring 5 of his favorite thinkers: Steve Pinker, Dan Lloyd, Ruth Millikan, David Haig and Nancy Kanwisher. 


More info & Registration HERE. 

:: :: ::

After the symposium, there will be a performance by Alarm Will Sound, the noted contemporary chamber orchestra, in the Granoff Music Building of "Mind Out of Matter," a new orchestral piece by noted composer Scott Johnson, featuring the sampled voice of Daniel Dennett. This symposium is sponsored and organized by the Tufts University Center for Cognitive Studies, with generous support from the Provost's office.

:: :: ::

Tufts University

Center for Cognitive Studies

51 Winthrop Street, ​Medford

:: :: ::

• Steven Pinker, Prof. of Psychology, Harvard University

• Dan Lloyd, Prof. of Philosophy, Trinity College

• Ruth Millikan, Prof. Emeritus of Philosophy, University of Connecticut

• David Haig, Prof. of Evolutionary Biology, Harvard University

• Nancy Kanwisher, Prof. of Psychology and Brain Sciences, MIT

Contact: Teresa Salvato, Program Coordinator


:: :: ::

Dennett’s Program Notes on Mind Out Of Matter 

Mind Out Of Matter is an evening length work commissioned by the celebrated new music ensemble Alarm Will Sound.  The piece is based on the brilliant and often controversial ideas of renowned philosopher and author Daniel Dennett (Darwin’s Dangerous Idea, Consciousness Explained), and these ideas appear here in Dennett’s own sampled voice, taken from a talk about his book “Breaking The Spell (Religion as a Natural Phenomenon)”, and interviews with myself. 

As with my previous “speech music” work, reaching back 35 years to ”John Somebody”, the sampled voice is woven into an instrumental score based on transcriptions of the natural melodies and rhythms of the recorded speech.“Mind Out Of Matter” offers a meditation on a human consciousness capable of gradually discovering its own origins in the physical universe, or of obscuring matters with supernatural stories when reality seems too complex, mysterious, or unfair.  I’ve tried to imbue this music with the sense of awe and wonder that lie at the heart of Dennett’s scientifically informed philosophy, while still emulating his gift for crafting a disarmingly playful presentation -- with musical references ranging from Baroque recitative to retro funk grooves, framed by passages of lush orchestral density.  With the humanistic values of the Enlightenment under perennial threat, Dennett brings infectious good humor and warmth to his optimistic account of our species’ steadily advancing understanding of how the world actually works. 

What are the origins of human consciousness and civilization, and the human religious traditions that claim to explain them?  Dennett’s answers extend Darwinian principles into the realm of belief itself.  Just as plants and animals evolve in the physical environment, so do ideas and traditions compete within ecosystems made up of human minds and cultures.  They populate our minds, multiply within our cultures, and spread like viruses -- sometimes to our benefit, sometimes not.

If you are interested in learning more about this concert, please call the Granoff Music Center Box Office at[masked] or email: [masked]

Cornbeef and Cabbage, Irish and other food available for purchase.

We encourage everyone to take the T as there is no parking at the Brewery.

Please visit www.harpoonbrewery.com or call 888Harpoon ext. 3 for more details.

There is a designated driver offer from Harpoon.

results.description:
MFA First Friday Social Art Evening Museum of Fine Arts (West Wing Information room),Address: 465 Huntington Ave, Boston, MA 02115 tel[masked]


<------

Save wait time in line by entering the rear (Fenway )entrance of the MFA since the front gets busy.

<---------

ORGANIZER: Jimmy he will have signs out on the back tables at the MFA Ruth and Carl J. Shapiro Family Courtyard.

TARGET AUDIENCE: All Members of ALL AGES that like Art and a relaxed social atmosphere!

Admission: $25 per person -- Free for MFA Members. ...If you are an MFA members please try to arrange through comments to help get other members of our group in as your guest for free. You can also try to get a discount pass at your local library get you in for free or $10 a Person. Hey we all need to save a few bucks for drink later right?

Drop off your coats, buy your entry tickets and meet us all at the SHARF VISITOR CENTER at 5:45PM. After that try to find us in the Ruth and Carl J. Shapiro Family Courtyard its where the party is at. and it the big tall room with the huge green glass Chihuly art piece is in. Stay as long as you want. MFA First Fridays ends at 9PM the Museum closed at 9:45PM.

MFA First Fridays is on the first Friday of each month from 6:00–9:30 pm. Join us for fine art, music, cash bars featuring signature cocktails, and delicious tapas available for purchase. Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

Accepted forms of identification for First Friday entrance include:
Massachusetts Drivers License
Massachusetts Liquor ID
Massachusetts ID issued by the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles
Drivers License from any US state
Valid Passport (photocopies are not accepted)
Federal Identification (e.g. Military ID)

We can mix and mingle with fellow art lovers,  enjoy the art,  the music and sip on our lovely drinks. hen we can break off and look at some more art since the rest of the museum is open!

Hope you can make it out this fine Friday Evening out for some Art Culture and great conversations.

======================================================

Notes for Parking for the MFA: It will be busy and lots tend to fill up fast so try to get there early! Taking the T is your best bet!

Self Parking Options: Visitors to the MFA have three self-parking options: the Huntington Lot, the Fenway Lot, and the Museum Road Garage, all of which have entrances on Museum Road. The Huntington lot offers closer parking to the Huntington Avenue Entrance and the Fenway parking lot is more accessible to the State Street Corporation Fenway Entrance. MFA lost Park costs $$$ over $20 so be prepared.

Subway Take the Green Line E train to the Museum of Fine Arts stop, or the Orange Line train to the Ruggles stop.

The Huntington lot offers closer parking to the Huntington Avenue Entrance and the Fenway parking lot is more accessible to the State Street Corporation Fenway Entrance. MFA lost Park costs $$$ over $20 so be prepared.

Subway Take the Green Line E train to the Museum of Fine Arts stop, or the Orange Line train to the Ruggles stop.

results.description:
The Museum of Fine Arts is open from 6PM to 9:30PM on first Fridays. The entire museum is open. In the Shapiro Courtyard (the indoor courtyard with the Chihuly green glass Christmas Tree and the restaurant) the MFA sets up a cash bar and a DJ. From 6PM its mostly at 40-60 set to talk. After about 7PM the volume of the music goes up, the 25-35 year olds arrive, and the event shifts from talk to dancing. The place often fills up a bit after 7, so don’t be later than that.

http://www.mfa.org/programs/special-event/mfa-first-fridays

Museum admission and event ticketing. The event is free with museum admission, either for members or general admission ($25, $23 for seniors), either at the door or online at http://www.mfa.org/visit. Many local libraries sell discounted tickets, for example two tickets for $10. Also, many employers may have discounted or even free tickets for their employees, check your human resources department.

First Friday is separately ticketed (at no additional charge), even if you are a member or preticketed.  You need to go through the admission line to get a separate ticket.  The line is tolerable at 6:00PM, and way way bad at 6:10.

If people have dual memberships they can get others in for free. As we gather at the front lobby, we can figure out any ticket sharing arrangements.

Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

It's not complicated.  Just show up and find one or another of the Meetup groups.  Someone will point you to the right lines to stand in, and maybe share a ticket.


Transportation. Public transportation strongly recommended, parking is a pain. The Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Directions by every transportation mode at http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

Meeting up with others—how to find us. The Fine Culture in Boston and Culture Vultures groups meet in the Huntington Avenue main entrance lobby at 6PM near the statue of Orpheus and Cerberus (3 headed dog). Then we will head in at 6:10.

If you arrive later, as you enter the courtyard, look to your left, and meet us at the tables near the elevator station with the poster of the current show.

Please change your RSVP if you can not make it.

After. The event closes at 9:30.  We can go out after for food or drinks at a convenient location, such as a restaurant on Huntington Ave.
results.name: MFA First Friday—Conversation, Art, Music, Dancing

group.name: Fine Culture in Boston (and International Travel)

results.description:
ART, MUSIC, DANCING

Let's meet out in the lobby in front at the main entrance at 6pm. near the statue of Orpheus and Cerberus (3 headed dog). Then we will head in at 6:10 to make sure we get in. We will congregate and get some tables to the left near the big cube with the poster, which has the stairs and the elevator behind it.

Try not to be late, as it fills up quickly and then they stop letting people in. I am BIll, 6'4".

The cost of museum entry is $25, but if people  have dual memberships they can get others in for free, so if you have a dual let us know via meetup comments, or RSVP comment.

I will usually email my phone # before the event to attendees so if you miss us in the foyer you can call or text (preferred) if you can't find us when/if you get in.   Look at everyone's pictures so we know who is going.  I will try to bring a copy of the pictures and will keep an eye out to say hi & introduce people.

BE SURE TO GET THERE EARLY, AS THE PLACE FILLS UP AND THEY TURN PEOPLE AWAY.  You need a license or Mass ID to enter.

Please change your RSVP if you can not make it.

We can go out after for food or drinks at a convenient location, such as a restaurant on Huntington Ave.

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

Join us at the MFA First Friday in December.

You will be able to enjoy fine art, music, cash bars featuring signature cocktails, and delicious tapas available for purchase.

Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

Tickets

For Members, you may order free tickets for this event on the MFA web site.

For non-members, you  may purchase your tickets that include general Museum admission in person on the day of the event on a  first come, first served basis, or in advance, online.

For discounted/free tickets. The cost of general admission is $25 ($23 for seniors).  However, you may be able to get a discounted ticket at your local library.

Your local library most likely has discounted passes available.  Typically the discount is two tickets at $10 per admission.  Also, many employers may have discounted or even free tickets for their employees. You may want to check your human resources department if such discounted/free tickets exist for you.

The MFA website strongly recommends that you purchase your tickets in advance due to the risk of  this event selling out.  I heard that this event rarely sells out, however it sometimes happens in the summer months.  I just wanted to give you fair warning. 

The plan is for the group to meet at 6:30 pm in lounge/couch area of the Sharf Visitor Center on the first floor.  This event officially starts at 6 pm and typically there are multiple other MeetUp groups that meet at  6 pm or earlier.  To avoid the confusion and to allow extra travel time, I am setting the meeting time 30 minutes after the official start time.  The plan is to meet at  at 6:30 pm in lounge/couch area of the Sharf Visitor Center, congregate as a group for 15 minutes or so, and then walk a few steps away into the main social event at the Shapiro Courtyard. 

Since this event will be a somewhat crowded and roaming , it will be very difficult for latecomers to connect with the group. If you are late, I can not guarantee that you will recognize me or fellow members or we  to be able  recognize you from the crowds.  Once the event starts, I put away my smartphone and concentrate on enjoying the event with fellow group members.  Please plan ahead and allow a little extra travel time to this event. Typically, there are a lot Meetup groups present.  There are usually Meetup signs posted at the tables near the entrance to the courtyard.  If you are late, don't be shy and introduce yourself.  A lot of attendees are regulars and will most likely point you other members of the group. 

If you need to familiarize yourself to this location, here is a link to the floor plan: http://mfas3.s3.amazonaws.com/MFA_Map_Sep2015_Level1.pdf

I strongly recommend that you  take public transportation, the Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Check out these links for more information on getting to the museum: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

http://mfas3.s3.amazonaws.com/styles/grid-3_thumbnail_retina/s3/mfa-summer-fridays-landing-page_0.jpg?itok=i2jETF4C
results.how_to_find_us: 6:30 pm at the Sharf Visitor Center couch/lounge area

results.description:
Bernie is this Month's Film

with with Jack Black, Shirley McClaine and Matthew McConaughey

A Black Comedy/Drama about a most-beloved, small town assistant funeral director, Sunday-school teacher, choir member and creator of spectacular funerals, is a friend to everyone, including a rich but nasty widow whom no one else likes. When Marjorie is found shot to death and stuffed in a freezer, our hero is charged with the murder, and concerned citizens immediately spring to his defense.

BYOB. Bring your own beer, wine or soda and experience the places where Pop culture meets our faith. We will watch a current film followed by a discussion about themes of morality, faith, and humanity.

Come—create community and conversation!

Call or email to ask us about the film title! or sign up for mailing list to receive information about the monthly film being offered. Our licensing agreement provides us with access but does not allow us to market the film title to the general public.Call <a>[masked]</a> or email <a>[masked]</a> to find out the film title and to get on our mailing list for details about our monthly Faith and Film events as well as our other Arts and Inspiration programs (music, art gallery, and the spoken word).

http://sanctuaryucc.org/event/arts-and-inspiration-faith-and-film-5/

results.name: Bernie: "an oddly endearing love story"

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

*****************************

Followed by

Listening to Your Body…Following Your Heart

with Linda Marks, MSM

How do we find our sense of purpose, our soul's calling, our sense of joy? The body is literally the temple of the soul, and the heart is the gateway in the temple. In a culture that is often cerebral, fast-paced and externally driven, we are often not taught to listen to our bodies for guidance and how to use the heart as the compass for our lives. In this workshop, incorporating heart meditation and body-centered exercises, we will have a chance to explore and listen to our inner resources and our natural soul-based guidance system: our body and heart.

A donation is welcome.

Linda Marks, MSM, has taught and practiced heart-centered body psychotherapy (Emotional-Kinesthetic Psychotherapy) for 30 years, working with individuals, couples, families and groups. She has written two books and led countless workshops in the United States and Europe. She is also a professional singer/songwriter and recently released Heart to Heart, a new CD of original and other favorite songs at Scullers Jazz Club. Her private practice is in Newton, MA. Listen to your body...follow your heart...

www.healingheartpower.com

***

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community and enjoy the healthiest meal on planet earth!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!

Do you want to meet new people who share your values? 
Do you want easily meet interesting new people? 
What's our celebration going to be like (see pictures) 

Join us for our popular Mix & Mingle celebration. The purpose of this Meetup is for you to meet people who are different from you. Discover new communities. 
Discover who else is coming. 

For this event we will be joining one of Boston's most popular nonprofits. 
Learn more:  Boston Volunteers

Space is very limited b/c the room is small. This event will fill up very soon. We'll get lots of the regulars and lots of new members. 

A couple other groups will be joining us including: 

Don't you like adventure: BBoston Adventures

Do you live near Brookline: Brookline Area 20's & 30's Adventurers 

Don't you like to do good: Boston Volunteers

We will be providing lots and lots of food for you. We will serve the food at close to 7:30, so don't miss it! 

Please bring a 10 bill with you to help cover our costs for the event, Meetup costs, and to provide more volunteer events for you in the future. Please bring a 10. There will be a long line, and we want to keep it moving fast. 


Oh, and by the way, we'll also be providing a drink ticket (good until 8:30) for you. Good for one refreshing and ice-cold spirit to quench your thirst. Complimentary! :) 


What a Hassle-free way to meet new people who share your values. 

We hope you can join us, :) 
Josh and friends

P.S. The Boston Volunteers supports public transport to get to all our events. Especially for this event b/c parking is very challenging near Faneuil Hall.

results.description:
The basis for realizing the Buddha’s all-knowing wisdom, inherent to all of us, is the accumulation of the two merits. Accumulating the two merits is based on the practice of the six paramitas. What are roots of practicing the six paramitas? For an answer to this question, please join Kyabgön Phakchok Rinpoche and the Natural Dharma Fellowship sangha on March 4th and 5th in Cambridge, MA. Proceeds from this teaching go to support Wonderwell: The Next Hundred Years.


• Friday March 4th - 7:00 - 8:30 pm

• Saturday March 5th - 10:00 am - 4:30 pm

• Register here:  http://bit.ly/20Jo9JA

Kyabgön Phakchok Rinpoche was born in 1981 and is a lineage holder of the Profound Treasures of Chokgyur Lingpa from the Nyingma School of Early Translations and one

 of the throne-holders of the Riwoche Taklung Kagyu Lineage. Phakchok Rinpoche’s primary root gurus are his grandfather, the late Kyabje Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche, and late Kyabje Nyoshul Khen Rinpoche. 

Phakchok Rinpoche has received a traditional education from the Dzongsar Shedra in India, the complete Chokling New Treasures lineage from Tulku Urgyen Rinpoche and Kyabje Tsikey Chokling Rinpoche, and the Great Perfection lineage from Nyoshul Khen Rinpoche. Rinpoche’s teaching style is direct, addressing the needs of those present; traditional, not compromising the methods of practice and transmission in the slightest; and, accessible, teaching the profound meaning in a way that is able to be understood and glimpsed by people of diverse backgrounds. 

As a yogi practitioner with a family and the responsibility of monastic institutions, Rinpoche is deeply familiar with both ways of life and practice. Rinpoche’s life defines what it means to be a dharma practitioner in today’s world by emphasising that a practitioner should find a balance in their life. There should be a base of study and contemplation in order to understand the profound views of the Buddhas teachings, and practice should be emphasized in a way that genuinely reduces ego clinging and negative emotions through a range of methods and practices. Altruistic activity should address the needs of those in one’s community and beyond as an expression of the compassion and wisdom cultivated in practice. These are some of the main principles that Rinpoche practices and teaches to his own students.
results.how_to_find_us: http://bit.ly/20Jo9JA
results.name: The Roots of Joyful Wisdom & the End of Suffering: An Urban Retreat

We are an international group of graduate students trying to make a difference. We provide situational awareness training. After the training, you will have learned some leadership skills and a mental frame of reference as to what to do in an unfortunate situation while at school or home. Class will be taught in English and instructors will also translate into Chinese, Portuguese and Hindi for further clarification. Many of our families worry about our safety while we are here learning in school or working in the United States. Great fun serious subject.

This is a fun hands on training of what to do in bad situation while with a group of people or as an individual. If you are a student or a small business, being prepared is paramount.
Our Learning objectives:

Situational awareness
Frame of reference
Run, Hide, Fight
Leadership


Format of training will consist of one half lecture and  one half hands on.
This will be an informal event so dress comfortable/business relaxed.
We have a English, Chinese, Brazilian, and Hindi speaking instructors.

results.description:
Theme for this session: "Connecting to Your Best Self": Ann will guide you through three transformative meditations to connect you to your inner brilliance, all the inner resources available to you, and the perfection that you are; so you can be your best self. She promises they'll be meaningful, valuable, AND even fun!


To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  You can also choose to pay for one class at a time for $20. These fees help to cover all of my costs and the significant time I put into running and preparing for all of the events and the meetup itself. Thank you!

Please RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner. Feel free to invite family and friends, too!

Here's the basic description and format for all of our meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time we meet, as well.  Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other!

Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you shift your perspective and experience of issues in your life causing you stress in some form, and to shift to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.

results.description:
With so many third-party plugins to choose from, it can be hard to decide what kind of software synth, drum machine, or sampler to use when creating sounds. Thankfully, Ableton Live comes with an assortment of powerful tools for sound creation that are more than enough to get you started and even be the basis of your sound library. From Ableton Live's synths like Operator and Analog, to its more unconventional instruments such as Tension, we will take a look at every instrument included in Ableton Live Suite and walk through what kind of instrument it is and how we can use it to create interesting and original sounds.

About the instructor: Subalias

Mitchell Owens is a guitar player, sound designer, and electronic composer/producer from Durham, NC. He attended Berklee College of Music right here in Boston and has over 5 years of experience with Ableton Live producing and performing music under the moniker Subalias, as well as doing sound design and soundtrack composition for independent films and animations. Mitchell’s music blends the organic and synthetic for a balanced fusion inspired by sample based Hip­Hop, Downtempo, House, Funk and R&B. He believes in freedom of creation and expression and likes to cater to students’ specific needs in order to teach them the proper skills and techniques needed to achieve their musical goals.
results.name: The Instruments of Ableton Live [3/4, #FREE]

Good morning, Fellow Investors, Contractors and Landlords,

Movers and Shakers.This evening 3/4/16 we meet at Denny's of Danvers.We'll begin with the local Real Estate and Financing market update.Then a Round Robin of what we're all working on and what we've had success with.We should have some Flippers, Wholesalers and Cleanout/Antique guys tonight in addition to our usual Investors, Landlords, Contractors and Private money Lenders. I've put together a Buyers CheckList for Robbie the Broker when she's working with her Buyer Clients. It's important to list your Needs and Wants and stay focused. It's been my experience that you'll only get about 70% of what you're looking for within your price range which is why it's important to work with Roberta upfront and not waste time in this hot market. The checklist is also useful so that you'll remember where you saw the amenities you were looking for, around house number 5 I start to mix them up so take the time to fill out a sheet for each house you look at.

And I'll have a copy of Robbie's CheckList for everyone tonight. Finally I'll cover the investments and projects I'm working on, if time permits.

7-8:30pm at Denny's of Danvers, 152 Endicott Street, just off 128. No charge for Members, $5. for non-members to tip our waitstaff. Light refreshments included.

Our main meeting is at WorldDepot 47 Newbury Street, (just before Sonic carhop on Route 1 North), Peabody, MA. Tuesday, March 29,[masked]:30 -9pm We're covering Property and Project Management, will it help get you to the next level. Hire a PM company, Employee or Contractor? No charge to members only $25 for guests or only $99/year to join.

See Keri at WorldDepot for hardwood flooring. I spoke to Keri at WorldDepot this week, she said that most rehabbers are now only Sanding and Polyurethaning but new floor installations usually pick up in the next week. She's got some great deals on Red/White unfinished 3 1/4" Oak and for the Engineered finished, flooring (Teak, Mahogany and Red Oak) it's a little more but eliminates a step and goes down quicker. It is worth checking out.

Interesting article from Depot on Kitchens and Baths at www.NewHampshireREIA.org and we meet in Nashua 3/30/16

See you soon, Mike Hurney, Director, MassRealEstate.net PO Box 307, Marblehead, MA 01945 Office[masked]

results.description:
A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  


_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Speed Dating as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.


Relax on a Friday night:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate!


Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous:  Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]

results.name: SOLD OUT Intimate Puja Circle

We offer a short (10 minute) introductory talk about a Buddhist topic and conclude with a half hour meditation session. Meditation is always free and guided in English. Street parking is available on the corner of Rockingham and Granite street and along Granite.  There is also a large parking lot with a Trader Joe's 2 minutes walk away from the center.

results.description:
Dance with us from 8:00 pm - midnight at The First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church at 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA.

The fabulous, fun-filled event begins at 830 and continues with dj'd dancing until  11 30 pm music provided by  volunteer DJ's Rockin  Robin and David H.

robin will warm up the night with a mix of lyrical singer song writers world beat and classic disco tunes

Like a fine chef, every month DJ David Hero creates a carefully crafted menu of tempting and tantalizing musical food for your soul, cooked to perfection. Using only the freshest ingredients and exotic spices from around the world, he serves up a varied banquet of delicious international rhythms, juicy organic grooves and flavorful melodies with lots of hot sauce and no leftovers.  He steers away from heavily processed beats and low-phat watered down tracks, instead allowing the full flavor and richness of the music to shine through. The flavors are so fresh they dance right off your tongue…So come down to Dance Friday in Harvard Square and satisfy your hunger.  Then come back for seconds.


Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

Dance Friday is an activity of the non-profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out.  We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can  move in.

For more information, please call: 6I[masked], go to <a>www.dancefriday.org,</a> or visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#/pages/Dance-Friday/[masked]?ref=ts
results.how_to_find_us: Please ask someone at the desk, & there are also plenty of friendly people there to talk to.  We're usually dancing!

venue.name: Gilliland Observatory of the Museum of Science Parking Garage

results.description:
Fridays, March – mid-November | 8:30 – 10:00 pm
Offering Format: Public Event
Recommended for grades Pre-K – 12 and adults
Museum of Science
Free

Did you know that the Museum offers our starry-eyed public a free evening full of astronomy-themed fun on weather-cooperative Fridays?

Between 8:30pm and 10pm each Friday, weather-permitting, visit the Gilliland Observatory on the roof of the Museum’s parking garage. On clear nights, you can view stars, planets, the Moon, and other astronomical phenomena. On cloudy nights, tour the inside of our Observatory, and participate in astronomy-related activities run by our knowledgeable staff.

This program does not run on nights when the weather is inclement. For more details, and to find out if Astronomy After Hours is running on a given Friday, call our hotline,[masked]-0267. We update each Friday by 5:30pm with the evening’s plans.

Astronomy After Hours runs seasonally, from the first Friday in March to the last Friday before Thanksgiving. Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute (parking charges still apply).

Thanks to Don Doughty for letting us know about the museum.

Source: http://www.mos.org/public-events/astronomy-after-hours
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet 15 minutes before the scheduled time and to the right of the line in front of the Astronomy building on the roof of the Museum of Science to be with the group. The Meetup group will wait for 10 minutes and then get in line.
results.name: Astronomy After Hours - Museum of Science

results.description:
Put on those fancy shoes and let's have Night of Dancing Fun with Salsa! Beginners are welcomed and encouraged to join. Havana club offers Free Salsa Lessons for 1 hour, from 9 – 10pm before they open up the dance floor for social dancing. If you always wanted to try, this is a professional setting and great environment to learn!

Details:
9-10pm Salsa Lessons
(Beginner and Intermediate Lessons)
10-2am Salsa Dance Party
21+

COST: $12  (Admission includes Lesson & Party) 

Dress Code: Smart Casual to Elegant
(No Ball Caps, No Work Boots, etc.)
Beer, Wine, Mixed Drinks, etc. available at Bar.

No Partner required Friday Night Salsa is Boston's biggest salsa dance party on Fridays featuring salsa dancing and lessons with Salsa y Control, an amazing venue filled with 300+ welcoming salsa dancers, an inexpensive parking garage next door, and public transport on Mass Ave. (Red Line, Buses 1, 64 etc.) one block away!

Website: http://www.havanaclubsalsa.com/salsa_fridays.shtml

Feel free to bring a dancing buddy or just make a new friend there! All levels welcome. Hope to see you all there!

-Xiao


********************Important Note********************
We will be meeting up early for Bubble Tea and Drinks at H-Mart in Central Square at 8pm in the Food Court area. Please come join us, as it will be much harder to socialize and chat when we are at the Salsa Club. This is Optional but Highly Recommended, as we won’t really get the chance to do a meet and greet when we are dancing the rest of the night away! 
********************************************************

Please note we use EventBrite for registration for this event. The Link is below.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/help-at-ms-stair-climb-tickets-21221023653
Here is your chance to help fight Multiple Sclerosis. The Multiple Sclerosis association needs your help their Stair Climb Event. Volunteers will be helping with registration, bag check, food area, water stops, spotters on each floor, greeting climbers, getting climbers into the correct location for their start times. The venue this year will be the John Hancock Tower.

About the Stair Climb:

Participants will climb 61 flights of stairs to the top of the John Hancock Tower, New England’s tallest building. Climb to the Top is a unique event that raises funds to help more than 19,000 people in Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Vermont affected by multiple sclerosis, a disease of the central nervous system that has no known cause or cure. Your participation in Climb to the Top provides help for today and hope for tomorrow through education, support, advocacy, and research funded by the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, Greater New England Chapter.
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet in the main lobby of the John Hancock Building.
results.name: Help at the Ms Stair Climb at the John Hancock Tower

results.description: Does anyone other than me have a hard time starting a long run by climbing Heartbreak Hill? How about a 2.25 mile warmup? We'll leave Brueggers, go west to the path along the river, run up to the asphalt circle and go back to Brueggers to start with the 8:30 run. We'll need to leave promptly to be back in time.
results.name: Warmup - Comm Ave Long Run

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
Join us for our weekly weekend run! We'll be meeting in Back Bay and logging some miles around Boston. All paces and runner levels are welcome!

During the winter months, we'll be meeting at the Boston Marathon RunBase on Boylston street for our Saturday runs. They have lockers and showers available for your use though you'll need to provide your own lock if you plan to use a locker.

Please post your desired pace and distance when you RSVP.

We have two main routes this week, a 6 mile route and a 10 mile route (we can always other distances as well). For both routes runners will follow Comm. Ave past Boston University to Allston and then run through side streets of Brookline near Coolidge Corner before heading back to Boston along Beacon Street and back onto Comm. Ave. Runners doing the 10 mile will continue on Comm Ave towards the Public Garden, crossing to the Esplanade at Arlington. Runners will head northeast along the river and cross back over at Charles Street and then head south. Runners will turn left onto Beacon for a partial loop of the Common and then return to RunBase along Boylston. 10 mile route: http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/?r=6812248

6 mile route: http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/?r=6811659
results.name: Whippets Weekend Run

group.name: Dashing Whippets Running Team - Boston Chapter

results.description:
Note:  This Meetup will always say "full" with only the organizer attending. In order to reserve your spot, you must sign up at www.llbean.com/dedham

Join us for a hike of Noon Hill Reservation in Medfield, MA. One of the most remote and unused Trustees reservations in this area, this area is part of the Bay Circuit Trail .  We'll explore Holt Pond, explore Shattuck Reservation on the Charles River and ascend to Noon Hill Summit with a view of the entire area.

Note:  Noon Hill road is a dirt road.  It's only a short drive on this road to the trail head.

ACTIVITY LEVEL:  Moderate. 

WHAT TO BRING:  Weather appropriate clothing, waterproof boots, water for 3 hours, snacks, sunglasses, hat & gloves.
results.how_to_find_us: Park at the trail head at Holt Pond (you'll see signs at the site, the parking spots are parallel to the road)
results.name: Hike Noon Hill Reservation

venue.address_1: 9 Russell Ave, Corner of Mt. Auburn St.
venue.name: Church of the Good Shepherd

results.description:
• [Don't be concerned if you don't see many RSVPs here... our members tend to RSVP via our members site at WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org.]

Please arrive at 9:00 am. From 9 to 9:15 am, we set up the meeting and network. We start the meeting at 9:15 am, and continue until 10:45 am. When you enter Church of the Good Shepherd, walk downstairs and take a left. If you arrive late, just walk in and have a seat at any open spot.

Please visit "Meeting Roles & Responsibilities" for more information about what to expect from a club meeting.

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting:

9:00 AM Setting up/Networking

9:15 AM President's Greeting and Club announcements

Welcome all to the First Watertown Saturday club.

Toastmaster's Welcome 

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Invocation

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Grammarian's Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Scheduled Speeches


Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction


Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations


Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Grammarian's Report

Grammarian reports on how many times speakers used the Word of the Day and how we used the English language.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement.

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

General Evaluator's Report

General evaluator provides a review of the meeting, what went well, and areas for improvement to encourage continual growth and an optimal quality of our meetings.

Toastmaster's Closing Remarks 

10:45 AM President Adjourns Meeting

We usually have a convivial lunch at The Red Lentil. Hang around after the meeting for details.

WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: Park on Russell Avenue and enter Church of the Good Shepherd from Russell Avenue. When you enter, walk downstairs and take a left.
results.name: Watertown Saturday Toastmasters club meeting

results.description:
The Play-in at Brandeis University is just two days away, and we are looking forward to having all of you!
The event will take place in the Slosberg Music Center at Brandeis. Brandeis's address is 415 South Street, Waltham, MA. When you reach the main entrance, turn left, and Slosberg will be the first building on your left. There should be parking in Slosberg's lot, but if there is not, continue to the next building, and turn left into the lot immediately past it. All parking is free. 
Additionally, don't forget that the lunch will be a potluck, and I would encourage all participants who will be staying for lunch to contribute something. If you are unsure of what to bring, log onto perfectpotluck.com with the login Brandeis and password 02453 to see some suggestions and to sign up your dish so that others can plan accordingly, and we won't have too much, or too little, of one thing. 
Finally, if you have any music that you have been preparing or that you have always wanted to play but have not had musicians to play it with, feel free to bring it. Participants will be able to create their own groups throughout the day based on interests and ability, and the more music, the more fun!
Thank you, and all of us at Brandeis look forward to seeing you on Saturday,


PLEASE NOTE: YOU NEED TO SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT AT

http://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Bg0yHg6ZKHc4nAcfvZI2qqNImqMJcccankA7DQvjHF0/viewform
Brandeis University ACMP Play-in and Potluck
The play-in at Brandeis University will run from 9-5 on Saturday, March 5th, and is open to the general public. The address is Slosberg Music Center, 415 South Street, Waltham, MA. A light breakfast will be provided, and please consider bringing a shareable dish for the potluck lunch, and label it clearly. More details will follow. Email [masked] with questions. http://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Bg0yHg6ZKHc4nAcfvZI2qqNImqMJcccankA7DQvjHF0/viewform

http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10207746906571298&set=p.10207746906571298&type=3&theater
results.name: (Leaderless) Brandeis University Chamber Music Play-In

results.description:
Their major issue is that they have tons of donations, and not even close enough amount of volunteers, to sort useable vs. recycle goods.  

http://thewishproject.org/ 

The Wish Project is a non-profit dedicated to providing free furniture, home goods, baby goods, and clothing to people in need in the Merrimack Valley, primarily through reuse and recycling. They serve thousands of people each year, and rely on the help of many volunteers. Let's be some of those volunteers! We'll take on whatever task they need on this day, but generally it involves sorting and organizing donations so they can be given out to clients. Children ages 8+ are welcome to join the effort. It's a great opportunity to teach your kids compassion in a very hands-on way. 

IMPORTANT:

If you are bringing children, please make a note in the comments section so I can give the Wish Project an accurate count of adults and kids who will be attending.

http://thewishproject.org/

 *PLEASE NOTE:  When you RSVP 'yes' it becomes a commitment. I am in contact with the volunteer coordinator, Patty, whom is now a member, giving her a head count. She then creates a list of things that need to be done -relying upon the number of volunteers. If your plans change, please be considerate -take a moment to update your RSVP to 'no.' It's very simple- and greatly appreciated! Thanks :)
results.how_to_find_us: The WORD is out, n' spreading!
results.name: Giving Back aka Volunteering @ The Wish Project - Lowell
