results.description:
Hi Soccer Comrades! 

The weather Sunday is predicted to be sunny and reasonably pleasant and (about 41° fahrenheit / 5 °celsius).  Please come and kick the ball around for an hour or so beginning at 12:00 noon.  We will do this at the turf field of Belmont High School, as we have in recent weeks. A few things to remember:

This is the "kinder and gentler" friendly, coed, game for people of all ages and nobody should get too serious: we want to avoid any injuries.

Each player should bring a WHITE shirt and a BLACK or DARK BLUE shirt, so as to make team formation easy.  Please wear shin guards. This is a friendly game but we want to avoid accidental injuries. Cleats are recommended.

Somebody should bring a ball and some cones to mark the field.  (I always do, but I hate everybody to rely on me).

Everybody should bring some water or something to drink, even in this cold weather.

You can find the location at Google Maps with the link: https://www.google.com/maps/@42.39523,-71.1674112,17z

The turf field is located just to the right of the Viglirolo Skating Rink

<a>www.acmp.net</a>

results.description:
Think of this as a creative mini-retreat. It's designed primarily for writers—of all experience levels, working in any genre. Although we've booked the space for 6 hours, you're welcome to arrive and leave whenever you like. 

WHAT WE'LL DO: 

• Noon: Doors open.

• 12:30 p.m.: Write to easy creative prompts (if there's interest). 

• 1 p.m. sharp: Begin writing.

Although we'll be in the same large room, we'll be writing in companionable silence, talking only during breaks. If you'd like to have a conversation with someone, you're welcome to step into another room upstairs or head to a nearby coffee shop.


• About 4:30 p.m.: People will be invited to briefly share from their work, if they wish. (Sharing is optional and time will be limited.) No one will critique anyone's work unless the writer requests feedback. 

• 5:30-6 p.m.: Clean up and depart. 

AMENITIES: The Braintree Community Arts Center is a newly converted two-story house about 3.5 miles south of South Shore Plaza on the road (Route 37). We'll have the house all to ourselves for the day. It's bright, pleasant, and equipped with tables, chairs, restrooms, a coffeemaker, a fridge, a countertop range, free parking, and Wi-Fi. I will provide a few books for inspiration, and an extension cord and power strip for power.

WHAT TO BRING: Yourself, your writing projects and writing implements (computer or  writing notebook and pen, or journal). Bring your own beverage. Feel free to bring a snack to share—but that’s entirely optional.

COST: $15 (cash or check), regardless of how long you stay. This goes toward space-use costs and our Meetup fee.  

HOW TO RESERVE A SPOT: RSVP "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. The RSVP list is our official headcount for the day, so it's the only way to sign up—emailing the organizer or posting messages on the site won't hold a spot.

CANCELLATIONS: If we need to cancel due to weather or any other reason, we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail all "yes" RSVPs as far in advance as possible. 

REMINDER ABOUT ABOUT RSVPs: Your RSVP is a reservation, and we're trusting that you'll honor it. If you can't make it, please change your RSVP from "yes" to "no" at least 24 hours in advance. If you cancel with less than 24 hours notice, or if you RSVP "yes" and then don't show up, you'll be asked to pay the fee anyway to help cover our costs for the day. 

Looking forward to seeing you!
results.name: Meet to write in companionable silence

results.description:
WARNING: this event will start at noon (30 min earlier than usual)  because the courts won't be available after 1:30 PM. If you can't make it, make sure you change your RSVP to No, such that someone else can take your spot.

We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

By attending a Boston Badminton meetup, you hereby agree to the terms of the following Liability Waiver:

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

As part of my membership to Boston Badminton on Meetup.com (hereinafter “Boston Badminton”), I hereby freely and voluntarily agree to the following Release, Acknowledgment of Risk, and Waiver of Liability:

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I understand, recognize and acknowledge that certain activities conducted by Boston Badminton or taking place in venues rented or owned by Boston Badminton are potentially hazardous. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. I further understand that, notwithstanding precautions taken by Boston Badminton, sports and fitness activities involve a risk of injury and/or death. I/we are voluntarily participating in these activities and using equipment and machinery with knowledge of the dangers involved. I hereby agree to expressly assume and accept any and all risks associated with my participation in activities conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates. I have read the foregoing and hereby agree to be bound by same.

results.description:
Come join us at our regular Scrabble Meetup, and play over lunch or a pastry and some coffee!

We meet twice a month, every month, on the first and third Sunday. Please bring a board if you have one. We have a few spares, so you are welcome to come even if you forget your board.

Newcomers are always welcome. We keep 2 and 3 letter "cheat sheets" for new folks to keep the playing field more even.

We mostly play Scrabble one-on-one, and pairing is random. If you would like to be matched up to someone of a similar skill, just let the organizer know.

Au Bon Pain is right next to the Davis Square T stop, and there is typically ample free street parking on Sundays.  A few times a year, there is a race in Davis Square that shuts down some streets, so keep an eye out for that. If possible I will send out a message to the group the day before.

$2/Meetup goes to help pay for the annual Meetup.com dues and miscellaneous photocopying, but if you are a regular $15/year will be easier for you and me to keep track of!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the people with Scrabble boards out--the cafe is usually empty on Sundays.

http://www.mapquest.com/places/winsmith-mill-market-at-norwood-commerce-center-norwood-ma-288112720

results.description:
Our group has moved to Especially For Pets in Newton.

EFP (Especially For Pets) has a safe enclosed playroom with rubber floors, restrooms (for humans) and tons of exclusive space for our pugs to run and play.  Our new Meetup facility will NOT be charging for our use of the facility.  If you would still like to make a donation to Pug Rescue of New England (our sponsor) we will graciously accept them at the meetup but a donation is not required.

The facility is very clean and well managed and they require all pugs attending the Meetups to have veterinary proof of Rabies & Distemper vaccinations. You will not be able to participate in the Meetup without these records from your vet.  Please have your records with you for EACH Meetup.

Free Parking is available in the Business lot next to the EFP's parking lot. 

Especially For Pets will also be offering our attendees a 10% of coupon to use in their store on the day of the Meetup!

EFP has been a GREAT supporter of PRoNE over the years and we are so grateful and excited to be moving our Meetup to their facility.

Check out our new home!  http://www.especiallyforpets.com/about.html


Thanks everyone and we look forward to seeing you!!

results.description: RAIN OR SHINE OR SNOW? Let's try a new place in Concord -- The Trail's End Cafe. There's an entrance on Lowell Rd. (right down the street from the Concord Center Rotary), but there's another entrance and better parking in the rear. results.description:
Please join us for a pleasant afternoon of competitive party bridge.

Bertucci's has its own parking lot, a welcoming atmosphere, and hearty food (including all-you-can-eat salads and soups).

Please sign up by Saturday afternoon, the day before the game. If at least 5 players have not registered by then, the game will have to be cancelled for that week.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play. No formal training will be offered, but this is a social, casual event, and bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed at any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.
results.name: SUNDAY BRIDGE  AT ALEWIFE "T"

results.description:
Where do you stand on the issue of Apple being required to hack their own smartphone security to help the FBI read what is encrypted on a terrorists iPhone?   Should the FBI be able to require Apple to create means to let the state read anything on your encrypted iPhone?  To create a backdoor?  Likewise the China's government requiring the same?    Why is Apple taking the stand it does?  What are some of the FBI's legitimate points? 

Can we have both have privacy and security?


Should you be free to use strong encryption?

Apple FAQ:  

"This has two important and dangerous implications:

First, the government would have us write an entirely new operating system for their use. They are asking Apple to remove security features and add a new ability to the operating system to attack iPhone encryption, allowing a passcode to be input electronically. This would make it easier to unlock an iPhone by “brute force,” trying thousands or millions of combinations with the speed of a modern computer.

We built strong security into the iPhone because people carry so much personal information on our phones today"

FBI Director James Comey:

"The San Bernardino litigation isn’t about trying to set a precedent or send any kind of message. It is about the victims and justice. Fourteen people were slaughtered and many more had their lives and bodies ruined. We owe them a thorough and professional investigation under law. That’s what this is. The American people should expect nothing less from the FBI."
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for Jim or the Inquisitive Minds meetup group
results.name: Apple, Privacy, Security, Encryption and the FBI.

1:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

results.description:
Plants grown from seed have greater genetic diversity, are better adapted to their environment, and are less expensive to produce. In this class you will learn when and how to collect seeds in the wild; how to collect, clean, and store them; and how to sow and tend for them. Emphasis will be placed on species that can be grown easily and without fancy equipment or large investments of time.

Instructor: Dan Jaffe, Propagator and Stock Bed Grower, New England Wild Flower Society

Mage Knight is an excellent game, both solo and multi-player. Your character explores the land, defeats enemies, gets stronger, etc., but is extremely strategic (e.g. no dice rolling for combat). It is currently ranked #9 on BoardGameGeek.

results.description:
Show of hands, who else has piles—I mean mountains—of Cook’s Illustrated magazines scattered throughout their house? According to my professional organizer friend, I’m a “horizontal” filer. Either way, that won’t stop me from holding onto these incredible magazines.


Similar to the "Featured Author" concept, this month we’ll be preparing recipes from the Cook’s Illustrated franchise of books, magazines, and website. Have a favorite recipe that you’ve made for family and friends? Or perhaps there’s a recipe you’ve bookmarked (or several), and you need an excuse to try it out. Well, you and your fellow cookbook collectors are the perfect dinner guests to experiment with.


Let’s come together and experience for ourselves the tried and true recipes from the folks at Cook’s Illustrated and America’s Test Kitchen. I’ve included additional details below, so read carefully.


• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

INSTRUCTIONS :: How the Cookbook Club Works

1. Join our Meetup group! All cooking levels are welcome. Don't be shy . . . you’re in good hands.

2. RSVP via Meetup. Each of our “Feast" events are on the 1st Sunday of every month, focusing on a different cookbook, author or blog. Everything is organized by me, but you're more than welcome to offer suggestions of some of your favorite cookbooks. Note :: If you RSVP YES and wind up being a “No Show” without any prior notice, I have to be honest and say that won’t work for this group. Please double check your calendar and make sure you can actually attend the event. Seating is limited for my events, and I wouldn’t want a spot to be held up when there’s an active wait list of members eager to sign up. I feel bad asking that, but at the same time, it’s kind of flattering if you think about it. What an active group we have, yay!

3. Skim through your myriad of Cook’s Illustrated magazines (or scroll through their website) and experiment with a few of the recipes that interest you. You’ll need to pick only one recipe for our Feast. Good luck narrowing it down!

4. You now have your recipe selected. Bravo! Be sure to read through all of the instructions to make sure you have the proper equipment, dishes, and ingredients. (I made that mistake at a previous Feast.) If you have time, you might want to do a test run with the recipe ahead of time. Some of our seasoned members take the time to try one or more recipes out before making their final selection (they are way more dedicated than me—and I love it).

5. In the Comments Section below, share which recipe you will be bringing, which magazine or book it is from, or paste the link from the Cook’s Illustrated website. I'll keep track of what everyone is bringing and make sure we don't have any overlaps. Note :: It might be wise to pick a backup recipe in case your 1st choice is already taken.

6. Day of the event. Prepare your recipe according to the directions provided in the cookbook. As tempting as it might be to alter the recipe or make a substitution, please follow the instructions as closely as possible. This will allow the group to truly experience the author's array of recipes. I'll bring salt + pepper, just in case. Note :: Don’t worry about doubling or tripling the recipe. With over 20 different dishes to sample from, we will have more than enough food for everyone.

7. Please print and bring 25 copies of your chosen recipe. Not everyone will have a copy of the book or magazine you are using. Providing a copy of each recipe will make our Feast all the more inclusive, and allow people to highlight their favorites. Post-it notes and pencils provided.

8. Come with an open heart and empty stomach! At my events, strangers quickly become new foodie friends with a shared passion for cooking. Together we will Feast on your wonderful food and talk about our cooking experiences. Gain new inspiration and learn from one another.

9. If you feel inspired to bring fancier serving dishes (for photos), I won't stop you! But it's not essential . . . just a little more fun.

10. Don't forget to bring a few small containers to take home leftovers. You'll have the best lunch the following Monday, guaranteed.


• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

WHAT'S INCLUDED :: (Stuff you don't have to worry about.)

1. Tables + Chairs

2. Linens, Tableware + Utensils

3. Extra Serving Utensils (in case you forget yours)

4. Water, freshly brewed coffee (with caffeine), hot cocoa, and assorted teas. Note :: If you want to bring wine or beer to share, please feel free to do so!

5. Photographer (me or my friend, Paul — pictures to be used mainly for our group photo album). You’re welcome to take your own pictures and upload them to our page!

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

TIPS + IDEAS :: (From our fellow cookbook collectors)

1. Go out of your comfort zone. Try a new technique or work with ingredients you've never used before. Bring the final dish, regardless of the outcome—good or bad—and let everyone learn from your experience! (Thank you Renee for this suggestion.)

2. There's no guarantee your dish will remain HOT by the time we are ready to eat. Consider recipes that travel well, and can also can be served at room temperature. Either way, you're welcome to bring your own heating elements, crock pots, or warmers. I just can't guarantee there will always be an outlet accessible.


3. If you come across a cookbook that would be great for the group, snap a picture of the cover and send it to me ([masked]). Or you can bring a copy with you and see what the group thinks of it!

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

IN CLOSING . . .


Never did I imagine this group to grow as fast as it has. Over 200 members in 4 months! I’m truly grateful for each of you and your enthusiasm for this culinary adventure. I look forward to meeting you all and getting to know you!


I spent the last week mapping out our entire calendar of feasts and food swap events for 2016. I’ll be posting up the events a couple months in advance. Great ready to have some serious fun!


And in case you overlooked my earlier note . . . Many of the members in this groups are super excited to be participating in our Feasts. So, if you're lucky enough to reserve a spot on the list . . . please be sure you can actually make it to the event. I wouldn't want spots to be inadvertently reserved, while other members are waiting to get on the list. Plus, it will help me get a more accurate head count for the venue. Thanks so much!


Warmly,
Jessica
results.name: March feast — Cook's Illustrated

results.description:
ONLY YESTERDAY ADVANCED TICKETS

ONLY YESTERDAY (PG)1 hrs, 58 minsRELEASE:2/25/2016CAST:Daisy Ridley, Dev PatelDIRECTOR:Isao Takahata

It’s 1982, and Taeko is 27 years old, unmarried, and has lived her whole life in Tokyo. She decides to visit her family in the countryside, and as the train travels through the night, memories flood back of her younger years: the first immature stirrings of romance, the onset of puberty and the frustrations of math and boys. At the station she is met by young farmer Toshio, and the encounters with him begin to reconnect her to forgotten longings. In lyrical switches between the present and the past, Taeko contemplates the arc of her life, and wonders if she has been true to the dreams of her childhood self. 

Written and directed by Studio Ghibli co-founder and Academy Award-nominee Isao Takahata (The Tale of the Princess Kaguya), Only Yesterday is a masterpiece of time and tone, rich with humor and stirring emotion, from one of the world's most revered animation studios. Critically acclaimed but never before released in North America, the film is receiving a national theatrical release in a new, Studio Ghibli-produced, English-language version in celebration of its 25th anniversary, featuring the voices of Daisy Ridley (Star Wars: The Force Awakens) and Dev Patel (Slumdog Millionaire).


Only Yesterday is a masterpiece from the legendary Ghibli Studio,  everyone had heard about but never had an opportunity to see.  For me, Japanese Anime of a legendary Studio is relatively new to me - and an opening into a whole, new, cinematic world.

Oh, and a 100% rating from Rotten Tomatoes.  

Join us whether an expert or a novice.  After, we'll go to CBC for brew and discovery.

John

results.description:
You can't set clear intentions energetically to use the Law of Attraction or magick if your boundaries aren't solid.  If your boundaries aren't good, then other people's energies will get drawn into your working and it can send it skewing way off your intended goal.  

Plus, bad boundaries also can cause you to:

• Be overwhelmed by other people's emotions 

• Be intimidating to others 

• Not be clear about your own feelings 

• Have a hard time being in crowded spaces 

• Lose energy to people who are needy 

• Have a hard time making an impact or getting things done 

• Have difficulties staying focused and/or grounded 

Having impeccable boundaries will allow you to:

• Feel solid and grounded no matter what is going on around you

• Be clear about your feelings no matter how strong others' emotions may be 

• Maintain your energy regardless of how much others may try to suck it from you 

• Not be labeled as "Too Big" or "Too Much" energetically 

• Create safe space for others

• Make a more solid and focused impact 

In this class, you'll learn:

• What affects your boundaries

• How to shift the way you hold them 

• How to retrain your energy field's default mode to hold them in the most effective way possible

Our last event SOLD OUT almost a week in advance of the class, so SIGN UP EARLY to guarantee your space!
results.how_to_find_us: Same building as #19
results.name: Setting Energetic Boundaries - SOLD OUT

Join us the first Sunday of every month (except May, 2016) in the Northeast Reiki Center classroom in Framingham for a Reiki Circle in the Usui Reiki System of Natural Healing. We are a gathering of Reiki practitioners and others interested in Reiki who share experiences, practice Reiki and support one another in building community and strengthening our inner Light.

Experience the higher dimension spiritual energy of the room as we collectively create a sacred space that will make the opportunity for healing available to each person attending. If you have never experienced Reiki, you will be able to receive a Reiki session and learn more about how Reiki helps you more fully express your human potential. Leave at the end of the gathering refreshed as you bring this positive, lighter energy out into your week, helping to make the world a better place! 

Plenty of parking available. 

Feel free to invite your friends and family members and share this information with them.
results.name: Free Community Reiki Circle

results.description:
Join us in reading and discussion around Yellow: Race in America Beyond Black and White, by Frank Wu


See the lower part of this description for our plan to share in the discussion of this book.


Description from Amazon:

Writing in the tradition of W. E. B. Du Bois, Cornel West, and others who confronted the "color line" of the twentieth century, journalist, scholar, and activist Frank H. Wu offers a unique perspective on how changing ideas of racial identity will affect race relations in the twenty-first century. Wu examines affirmative action, globalization, immigration, and other controversial contemporary issues through the lens of the Asian-American experience. Mixing personal anecdotes, legal cases, and journalistic reporting, Wu confronts damaging Asian-American stereotypes such as "the model minority" and "the perpetual foreigner." By offering new ways of thinking about race in American society, Wu's work dares us to make good on our great democratic experiment.

.......................

After our last book discussion, we decided to continue the dynamic of being responsible to present a part of the book.  We will all do our best to read the whole book, and then each choose a chapter to present about.  Plan for about five minutes of time.  Here are some ideas of things you might include in your presentation (choose any or do something else!):


• Summarize the chapter.

• What was especially important for you about this chapter?

• What questions did the chapter raise for you?

• Share a quote from the chapter.

• Make a connection to another book or resource.

• Create and share an artistic response to the chapter.

Please post the number for your chapter in the comments section below.  It's fine if you choose the same chapter as another person, though we'd like to be sure at least one person presents about each chapter. 

Because of space limitations, a maximum of 16 people can attend. Please be mindful when you RSVP that a waitlist is likely and update your RSVP if you're unable to attend or commit to reading the book.  

See you then!
results.name: Knapsack Book Discussion: "Yellow: Race in America Beyond Black and White"

Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Panera Bread in Porter Square Shopping Center

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Panera Bread is right next to Dunkin Donuts. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.


If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]

Well-behaved dogs are always welcome.   Dogs who are not licensed in Cambridge must stay on-leash.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 3/6 4:30

group.name: Boston Late Risers Hiking/Walking/Biking Social Meetup

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.

Well-behaved dogs are always welcome.   Dogs who are not licensed in Cambridge must stay on-leash.

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/

Sun 03/06/2016, 5:00 pm - 6:15 pm


In today’s world the mind is constantly busy trying to keep up with information flow and the challenges we are facing in such a fast paced life. It is as if the mind has taken over control of our lives. We have lost the ability to simply be still and in the enjoyment of life itself.

With the art and practice of meditation in our life we can bring back the mental clarity and peace in our life. It is  time for you to awaken your mind to its potential, to take back the reins and to live life from a sacred space that is created through a quiet mind.

results.description:
</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com">http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>
results.name: Speeddating Ages 37-47 -SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

results.description:
This is usually a quiet area so you can talk at a normal voice level!

People tend to "trickle in" to this event some even arrive early. So just be a bit patient. Waitstaff is not that reliable you may be better off ordering from the bar instead of waiting for them to show up, but they are very friendly and informative.  Oh, and, if you are really hungry they have an all you can eat buffet... & you get to watch them cook your chosen meal before your very  eyes!

MIX & MINGLE=

PLEASE DO NOT DRAW THE TABLES TOGETHER this is supposed to be a Mix and Mingle MEETUP; NO SPEECHES, just move from seat to seat tall table to tall table THIS SETUP IS INTENTIONALLY made to create a Mix and Mingle atmosphere!! For the social butterflies. 
  Do not get glued to your seats. Switch seats as often as possible. Or just stand and mingle!
  There is no pressure to order food.   Please pay as you go!! Cash better! 
  
I want you to see this incredible conversation from one of the last Polyglot meetups most people understood each other, need I say more!!?

http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Cultural-Nomads/events/224875977/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for each other at the smaller bar counter down the steps to the "tall" tables there, where there is seating nearest the bar.
results.name: Speakers of Foreign Languages (Polyglot) Meetup MIX & MINGLE

results.description:
The monthly Morningside Jazz Jam at Artlounge Arlington is a great way to meet people. Bring your instrument and sit in and meet a lot of other musicians, or just come and enjoy some live music. This jam is for instrumentalists. Vocalists, see message below.

Artlounge offers craft beer, wine and delicious snacks. For more information on Morningside Music Studio, visit our website, www.morningsidemusicstudio.com

There is a $6 cover charge


For vocalists, you should instead go to the monthly Boston Jazz Singer Showcase/Open Mic and Ryles - more info at https://www.facebook.com/BostonJazzSingersShowcase?ref=hl

Next vocal showcase is March 8th at Ryles

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - Boston

results.description:
Concert Film Screening: “Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders From Mars”
On the BIG SCREEN in CONCERT SOUND
Tickets: All Seats are for General Admission
(First Arrivals are Seated First and Doors Open at 7:00pm
$10.00 In-Advance
$12.00 Day-of-Show
$7.00/$9.00 for All Regent Members ($3.00-OFF for ALL Movies)

Ziggy played guitar—and then he quit. On July 3, 1973, on-stage at London’s Hammersmith Odeon, David Bowie took his leave of the previous 18 months of stardom and insanity with one of the most legendary performances of his entire career. Documentarian D.A. Pennebaker (“Monterey Pop”) was on hand to catch it with what remains the most captivating and electrifying Bowie live footage of all.

The feature length film captures the aura surrounding one of the most unusual and revered musicians and stars of this or any era.
Framed by a smattering of behind-the-scenes footage, the bulk of the film concerns the actual concert, notable as the final time that Bowie would perform under the Ziggy Stardust persona, an announcement that, at the time, led many fans to mistakenly believe Bowie was retiring altogether.
Features numerous songs from Ziggy Stardust, Hunky Dory, Aladdin Sane and other Bowie albums, including “Ziggy Stardust,” “Moonage Daydream,” “Changes,” and “Space Oddity,” as well as a cover of the Velvet Underground’s “White Light/White Heat.” Though a shortened version of the film was broadcast on television in 1974, the film did not receive a full theatrical release until 1983.
results.name: Let's watch Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars on the big screen

results.description:
Let's try skating again!
This will be at Steriti Memorial Rink, which is on Causeway Street in the North End (about a 5 minute walk from North Station). It only costs $5 to rent skates there. If you have your own ice skates, it's free!

If you don't know how to skate, that's okay! I'm a super-beginner too. Let's learn together! There may be others coming who have not registered an RSVP, so expect more people than you see on Meetup.

When you enter the building, please go around the rink to the left and look for the skate rental/snack bar booth. We will meet on the benches near this area, and then we'll get our skates.

Here's a map of the area so you can find the rink from North Station/TD Garden:
results.how_to_find_us: Walk left around the rink until you find the skate rental booth and snack bar. We'll gather near there!
results.name: Ice Skating in the North End

results.description:
Come dance with us, Sunday March 6th, at 1950 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge MA.

Caller: Angela DeCarlis
Music: Debby Knight and Ethan Hazzard-Watkins leading an Open Band! 

Bring your instrument and join the open band! Show up early for the sound check, or join as you can. 


Dance 7:30-10:30pm
Dessert Potluck during the break -- Bring something to share! **Please feel free to join us at 7:00 for a beginner's lesson if you're fresh to contra dancing! $5-12 sliding scale, as you're able. Bring someone new to Contra to the intro session and you both get passes for free admission to a future dance! Share the love. Public Transportation (recommended): We are across the street from the Porter Square Red Line stop.

Parking: Free street parking (meters and residential are open to all on Sundays). Don't park in the Shaw's parking lot because they tow.

See you there!
results.name: BIDA 1st Sunday Contra Dance and OPEN BAND!

results.description: We had a good time playing Dominion and Exploding Kittens at the last Meetup. Happy to bring those back or try out anything you want to bring along. Hope to see you there! --Andrew
results.name: Gamenight @ Redd's

results.description:
Players,

We'll run 3 - 40 minute sessions of doubles play with the teams being mixed up after each session.

The event could be mixed doubles or all-ladies doubles or all-men's doubles. It will really depend on who enrolls week to week.   It's all about playing 2 hours straight of doubles tennis.

• New pricing structure because we're being charged more for the courts.

• $24 for the last sign-ups.


If you want to purchase 5 Round Robins you can pay $105 (Save yourself $15 from full price) in cash at any of the events.


YOU HAVE TO RSVP to guarantee your spot in the Round Robin, we can't guarantee walk-ins a spot due to potential court limitations.

*Please understand that we have a zero tolerance for no-shows. If you say you are attending and no-show you won't be eligible to commit for future round robins.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs before the start of the session.

Come join me and my twin charges for a learning experience Monday morning at Boston's MFA. The March theme is shapely line. The Museum opens at 10:00 and classes start in groups of 8-10 kids at 10:15 so try to get there by 10:05 to get a ticket. You only have to pay for adults' entree, the kids are free and the program is free. There is always a take home art activity at the end.
Check it out here:

results.description:
Reservation for 20 is booked!  Oceanaire Seafood Room http://www.theoceanaire.com  is a lovely, high end restaurant located in a historic bank building in Government Center.  The 3 course lunch menu for Dineout Boston is here:  http://boston.simpleviewcrm.com/docs/amenities/lunch2.pdf

Lunch is $25.   If you wish to order wine or other beverage, you can pay for that at the event...please bring cash to make that easier.

To rsvp "yes", please pay in advance.  $25.00, lunch, 6.25, tax/tip, 2.75 for credit card fees charged by Meetup, total = $34.  Payment is collected in advance to make it easier at the Meetup, and to encourage a commitment from those signing up. 

 If the event fills, please indicate an interest to participate if someone needs to cancel.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at hostess station in time for our 12:30 reservation.
results.name: Dine Out Week, Boston...Lunch at Oceanaire Seafood Room

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
KNIGHT OF CUPS

Release Date: March 4, 2016

Rating: Not Yet Rated

Synopsis

KNIGHT OF CUPS follows Rick, an uninspired screenwriter living on the event horizon of all the vice, and some of the virtues, Los Angeles has to offer. He is a slave to the Hollywood system; addicted to success but simultaneously despairing at the emptiness of his life. With the death of his brother Billy hanging over him like a shadow and his surviving brother down on his luck, Rick seeks distraction in the company of women. Women seem to know him better than he know himself, bringing him closer to the heart of things, closer to understanding his place. And while the parties, the dalliances, and the career remain unfulfilling - each woman, each man he’s met through the course of his life has served him in some way as a guide, a messenger. This visceral journey through one man’s City of Angels has just begun.


https://youtu.be/vl6BWTIZeOg

PLEASE update your RSVPs at this Eventbrite page. 

FYI:for our first meetup, we are doing a joint event together with TensorFlow group. The meetup will be devoted to TensorFlow solely.


Agenda:

5:30 - Doors open. Initiation of the new guild members. 
5:45 - Networking. Meet members of the guild. 
6:45 - Welcome. Members of the guild to vote on the topics of interests for the future meetings.  
7:00 - Fireside chat with Q&Awith Hai Tran, Darshan Patel and Syed Tousif Ahmed
7:15 - Talk #1: Neural Networks with Google TensorFlow 
7:45 - Q&A break 
8:00 - Talk #2: Transfer learning on Tensorflow in 30 minutes
8:30 - Q&A  & wrap-up.

Detailed agenda:


Fireside chat with Q&A with Hai Tran, Darshan Patel and Syed Tousif Ahmed

Talk #1: Neural Networks with Google TensorFlow by Darshan Patel 

- TensorFlow Terminologies 

- Softmax regression on MNIST dataset 

- Convolution Neural Networks(CNN) on MNIST / CIFAR 10 dataset 

-TensorBoard Graph Visualization 

-Scikit Flow / Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN)

Speaker: Darshan Patel

Darshan is a Machine Learning Enthusiastic Second year Computer Science Masters student in the College of Computer and Information science at Northeastern University. Prior to his master study, he was a software developer at TCS, India. His area of interests are Machine/Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence.


Talk #2: "Transfer learning on Tensorflow in 30 minutes"by Syed Tousif Ahmed 

- What is transfer learning? 
- How to collect data? 
- How to retrain a model in tensorflow? 
- Use cases and application of transfer learning

Speaker: Syed Tousif Ahmed 

Syed is a Computer Vision Developer working at Ahold USA. He is also a student in Computer Engineering at Rochester Institute of Technology. His area of interests are Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Cryptography and Internet of Things.

results.description:
Do you want (or need) to raise money to support the causes and organizations you care about? Join Socializing for Justice for a ProfDev (professional development) training Fundraising: Getting Past the Fear of Asking on Monday, March 7, 6:00 - 8:30 PM.

Fee: $15 advance/$30 door - split with trainer
Limited space - register ahead of time: www.sojust.org
Credit cards accepted online and at the door.
Newcomers always welcomed!

*This is a fragrance-free event. Please do not wear fragrances (scented lotions,  perfumes, etc.) or smoke just prior to attending. Thank you.*


Fundraising: Getting Past the Fear of Asking
 This engaging coaching session focuses on getting past the fear of asking and how to avoid some common mistakes. Learn an easy way to sort through contact lists and build a strong prospect list based on the 3 Cs of fundraising: capacity, connection and commitment. Learn specific language for how to make a strong ask, based on the relationship-building tips shared in Art of the Schmooze, and ten tips that will make your next fundraising plan a success. "If you are afraid to ask for money, kick yourself out of the way and let the cause talk."

ABOUT OUR PRESENTER


Robbie Samuels has been recognized as a networking expert by Inc. and Lifehacker, and profiled in "Stand Out: How to Find Your Breakthrough Idea and Build a Following Around It." Since 2009, his engaging and fun presentations have helped a wide array of audiences increase their networking and fundraising confidence. From[masked], Robbie was Senior Manager of Events and Donor Engagement at GLAD and coordinated up to 25 fundraisers and donor cultivation events a year. These fundraisers raised nearly one million dollars annually (25% of GLAD's budget). In 2006, he founded Socializing for Justice (SoJust.org) to build a cross-cultural, cross-issue progressive community and network in Boston. In recognition of his social justice work, Boston City Council named his birthday "Robbie Samuels Day" in 2011. Learn about Robbie and his work at www.RobbieSamuels.com

SCHEDULE
6:00-6:30 Socializing -  bring your own dinner
 6:30-8:30 Training and Q&A

*  DIRECTIONS - The NonProfit Center is located one block from South Station at 89 South Street. The Center is physically accessible through the main lobby.

HELP SPREAD THE WORDS!

Invite friends to the Facebook event. 
Join the SoJust Facebook group.

On Twitter? Follow @SoJust and SoJust's Co-Founder @RobbieSamuels. Don’t forget to tweet about this event using #SoJust and #profdev!


_________________________________________________________ 
Socializing for Justice - www.sojust.org SoJust hosts events that draw progressives of all stripes that share common values but may work on different issues. We host monthly socials that allow for the possibility of cross-issue connections and run a monthly ProfDev Series, hosted by The NonProfit Center*, which provides access to affordable professional development to increase our individual capacity for movement building.


With over 2800 members and 9+ years of creating a diverse cross-issue community in Boston (210+ events!), Socializing for Justice is the best place to find the great people, organizations and community you're looking for while putting the SOCIAL back in social justice.

YES, WE MEAN YOU. We've got members of all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism and professions. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.
results.name: ProfDev: Fundraising - Getting Past the Fear of Asking

results.description:
If you are a startup founder, you are facing the challenge of how to present your company to investors and to the world. This often proves to be a complex and overwhelming task with results far from the vision that you have for your business.  During this workshop, you'll learn the basics of good storytelling and how it relates to establishing your brand.

Armed with this new knowledge, you will:
● Know how to create the fundamental ideas will sustain your brand 
● Understand how these pillars can be used as tools to create content and guide all your communications
● Evaluate creative work more objectively and efficiently
● Make better and more engaging communication decisions yourself
● Be concise and compelling in order to drive action from investors, target audiences, etc.
● Save time and money while leading the image of your company in the right direction

This workshop is addressed to startup founders, and to anyone dealing with communication and positioning issues at their company or organization.

Takeaways:
7 essential rules to building your brand learnt through two live exercises.

SPEAKER: Iliana Rabago, Principal / Art Director at Solid Founder & LexCreative. Iliana is a Creative Director and Entrepreneur with over 14 years of international, professional experience in design, brand development and positioning, visual identity, collateral marketing, user experience and user interface design.

www.bostonspeaks.com 

More details at:


• http://goo.gl/forms/k952RE0sCE

results.description:
Plenty of parking in the rear of the office park. Go through the iron arch. 10 minute walk from red line.

 
Our speaker will be

Christine McBeth

Dr. McBeth will talk about the microbiology of the human body which is coated with over 100 trillion bacteria in one’s gut alone. They are vital to health and the immune system. She will pose the possibility that we are actually superorganisms driven by both our human genome and the genes of our bacterial partners. She will discuss what is known about these bacteria (‘our commensal flora’) and whether we can encourage their ability to thrive.

Dr. McBeth has a bachelor’s degree in microbiology from Brigham Young University, a PhD in structural immunology and molecular biophysics from the University of Washington, and completed a post-doctoral fellowship in infectious disease in the Department of Microbiology and Immunobiology at Harvard Medical School. She currently works at Frauhofer CMI in the biomedical engineering division.

About the Dinner: 

Usually about 20 to 35 people composed of members and meetup invitees. Social Hour: 6:30 p.m. Dinner: 7 p.m. Speaker : Around 8 p.m. You can come at any time.

RISTORANTE GRAN GUSTO

We have negotiated two reduced (!) price dinners. However if neither of these suit you you can order separately from their menu or not at all!

The two dinner choices are: A many(!) course Italian dinner at $36.00 or a pizza, appetizer, salad and desert dinner at $24.00. (The pizza is real authentic Italian pizza!) (tip included!) Or you can join the club and pay less per dinner!

Drinks can be ordered from the bar.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the bartender to point you into the gathering room.
results.name: Dinner and Are We Just Super Microbes?

results.description:
We were invited to an advance screening of Knight of Cups and discussion with Terrance Malick (the director)! It's first come, first serve so I am making the meetup 30 before the movie starts.

Terrance Malick movies are not for everyone so try to watch the trailers to have an understanding of what his style is. I had to watch Tree of Life twice to appreciate it because I had been expecting something different. You definitely have to see each scene as art and not worry about a tangible plot. It's worth it though! Tree of Life, I thought, did a great job of communicating the experience of a family after a loss of child.

Here is the trailer: Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vl6BWTIZeOg You can download the passes here: http://broadgreenscreenings.com/PRXay42081

Synopsis: Terrence Malick comes a visceral journey into the soul and world a writer [Oscar winner Christian Bale] on an odyssey through the playgrounds of Los Angeles and Las Vegas as he undertakes a search for love and self. Cast: Christian Bale, Cate Blanchett, Natalie Portman, Brian Dennehy, Antonio Banderas, Wes Bentley, Isabel Lucas, Teresa Palmer, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Freida Pinto, Cherry Jones, Joe Manganiello, Haley Bennett, Imogen Poots, Ryan O’Neal, Joel Kinnaman, Jason Clarke, Shea Whigham, Jocelin Donahue, Sergey Bodrov, Nick Offerman, Ben Kingsley Producers: Nicolas Gonda, Sarah Green, Kenneth Kao Executive Producers: Glen Basner, Tanner Beard
results.name: Advance Screening of Knight of Cups

results.description:
The second event in our Careers in Analytics Panel series, this panel will feature analytics professionals who are in management roles in several different industries. Come to learn more about what analytics managers do on a day-to-day basis, how they think about data, and what they look for during the hiring process, learn about the different industries they represent and much more. Event Details:
Date: March 7th, 2016
Time: 6:30 PM
Venue: LaCava 325

Pizza and beverages served!!

Join us for an informative and interactive panel session with… Brandon Rohrer – Cloud Data Scientist at Microsoft
Brandon loves solving puzzles and building things. Practicing data science gives him the opportunity to do both in equal measure. Like most data scientists, he came to the field indirectly. He studied robotics and human rehabilitation at MIT (MS '99, PhD '02), moved on to machine vision and machine learning at Sandia National Laboratories, then to predictive modeling of agriculture DuPont Pioneer, and finally to cloud data science at Microsoft. In his spare time, he likes to rock climb, write robot learning algorithms, and go on walks with his wife and their dog, Reign of Terror.


Justin Fortier - Senior Data Scientist, Director at Thermo Fisher Scientific
Justin is an accomplished advanced analytics and predictive modeling leader with more than 15 years of experience developing actionable insights which have driven profitable growth for five industry leaders. He possesses superb strategic leadership and problem solving skills. He is recognized for having led Subway to more than 20% annual sales growth, having lifted Staples to the highest retail customer satisfaction scores in its history, and having introduced predictive modeling to Constant Contact, which has driven over $2 million of incremental revenue.


Yuliya Akselrod - Senior Director Business Intelligence Analytics at Fresenius Medical Care
Yuliya is an experienced business leader and manager with proven track record of generating high value business insights using various market and company analysis and innovative reporting/analytics solutions to drive profitability. She has worked with PepsiCo in the past managing their Business Process Transformation and more recently she handled Business Intelligence Analytics and Reporting for Holcim. Presently, she is the Senior Director Business Intelligence Analytics at Fresenius Medical Care. Lauren Mottley - Data Analytics Manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers
[Bio to come]

Whiteny Kramer - Manager of Analytics at Iora Health
[Bio to come]

information can also be found at:

https://www.facebook.com/events/975736945847195/
results.name: Careers in Analytics Panel Series: Managing Analytics

results.description:
Building predictive models may seem intimidating at first, but the truth is its fairly simple when you break it down into its core components.  Modern modeling tools like Azure ML make it even easier with a host of complex functionality built into easy use drag and drop components.  Almost anyone with a good sense for data and a fair understanding of how business processes work can easily get started with their first predictive model.  In this webinar, we will walk through the following six steps and identify the areas where you likely already have the skills to succeed. 

Importing the data Cleaning the data Feature Engineering Modeling the data Scoring the data Evaluating the model

About this month’s speaker: JASON SCHUH

Analytics Practice Lead

As a data strategist with 18 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, predictive analytics and data architecture, Jason is skilled in helping stakeholders identify the problems they are trying to solve. He helps formulate data strategies for solving these problems and evolving the resolutions into longer term strategy.

Pizza and Soda (Free) provided by Pragmatic Works

Parking: There is free <a>MIT parking lot on Hayward Street</a>.  There is also a free lot across from the Alewife T stop at the <a>Summer Shack</a>. 

Note: 

6:20 PM ~ 7:00 PM Pizza and Networking time.

7:00 PM ~ 8:30 PM Main Session
results.name: Predictive Analytics: 6 Easy Steps to Getting a Predictive Model Up and Running

results.description:
Hello Marketing Technologists! Join us on Monday, March 7th from 6:30 to 8:30pm network, learn and discuss marketing approaches and the technology to support them.


Please sign up for this event here on our Meetup page since you won’t be allowed access unless you are on the list! Also, please bring a photo ID.


Speakers


Orlando O'Neill, Marketing Manager, Ministry of Supply, @oneillo

Marketing channels are crowded, and we are all competing for our customers' time and attention. The more we can learn about our customers' needs and behaviors, the better we can tailor our products and marketing to improve performance. Cluster analysis is a tool you can use to help uncover insights about your customers with the data you are already collecting. In this presentation, I'll provide an overview of cluster analysis and how you can take advantage of it by walking through an example of how we used it at Ministry of Supply to inform our segmentation and targeting strategy.


Peter Moloney, CEO, Loyalty Builders Inc., @PeteMMoloney   


Everyone knows the right product offer at the right time gets customers to buy more. But knowing exactly the right products to offer for each and every customer is not so obvious, especially in B2C scenarios. It certainly can get complicated to figure it out, and there are a lot of competing approaches out there. Learn what it really takes, and how not to get fooled into wasting time and money. 

Dan Scudder, Co-Founder and VP Growth Markets, LiveRamp (an Acxiom company)

Fragmentation is a barrier to better marketing.  Innovation of marketing technology has led to an abundance of marketing tech platforms and fragmentation of data.  Marketers today face the challenge of customer data existing in silos across all the different platforms in the marketing stack. Learn how top brands use data connectivity to implement cross-device and cross-platform unified marketing programs. 


Kristin Dziadul, Founder, KDMedia, @KristinDziadul

Launching and managing one marketing channel can be tough enough for a small company, and managing many can feel like a complete impossibility. A serial startup marketer, Kristin will provide actionable ways companies can develop a holistic approach to content marketing from Day 0 -- even on a limited budget and with very little resources. Attendees will gain a framework from which to base their own content marketing strategy off of as well as some tools and tips to get it all done.


Agenda


• 6:30: Pizza, refreshments, networking

• 7:00:  Welcome and Announcements

• 7:10 to 8:30: Presentations

• Wrap-up

Location

Microsoft New England R&D Center,  Mann/Sampson/Paul Room, 1 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA 02142

Directions to Microsoft New England R&D Center

For driving directions as well as to the NERD, please visit:http://microsoftnewengland.com/About

Parking

Parking is available at 1 Memorial Drive. Details can be found here.http://microsoftnewengland.com/About

THANK YOU to our generous sponsors!

ScaleUp Solutions provides full-time recruiting and staffing services to support small to mid-sized companies in New England.  Our top down approach helps us attract and retain many of the fastest growing startup and VC-funded companies in the industry.  We have an established track record of connecting the right candidates with senior management teams, helping build strong companies.  Many of our clients have started from the ground up, gained valuable funding, and been acquired or filed IPO.  We look forward to partnering with more high-growth companies and strong local talent. 


Microsoft New England (MSNE) is a major center for technical innovation and research. Located in the heart of Cambridge, Massachusetts, the MSNE campus includes two buildings—One Memorial Drive and the recently renovated One Cambridge Center. At the core of MSNE is the Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD). NERD is a world-renowned research and software development center, and is home to teams working on critical products and services like Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft SQL. NERD also serves as a center of gravity for the local tech community, having hosted more than 1,000 events and welcomed more than 100,000 visitors since opening in 2008.


See you there!

- Rick Kollmeyer

results.description:
Join us for an introduction to this unique Japanese martial art. Participants will all get a chance to practice some basic movements, explore a bit of the underpinning philosophy, and experience seated meditation. In short, we will have fun together learning about this martial way, one unknown to many in the United States. 

Shorinji Kempo is a relatively new martial art. It was founded just after WWII as part of a Zen Buddhist practice. Today, while the martial art has been separated from the religion, the practice of Shorinji Kempo remains true to it's Zen Buddhist roots, with philosophy and meditation still integral to the study in the dojo of hard (punches, kicks and blocks) and soft techniques (releases, joint locks and throws).
